title: LSU fires Kelly, still finalizing his $54M buyout
content: A day after a 49-25 loss to Texas A&M in Baton Rouge, LSU fired coach Brian Kelly on Sunday night, with athletic director Scott Woodward announcing in a statement that "we had high hopes that he would lead us to multiple SEC and national championships."

title: Love outduels Rodgers as Pack tout 'the successor'

title: Orioles tab Albernaz as next manager, sources say
content: The Baltimore Orioles are finalizing a deal to hire former Guardians associate manager Craig Albernaz, sources told ESPN on Sunday.

content: Mavericks rookie Cooper Flagg became the fifth-youngest player in NBA history to score at least 20 points in his first NBA win Sunday.

title: Red-hot Michael Brennan wins in Utah for first tour title

content: China has completed the construction of 36 hardened aircraft shelters at Lhunze, about 107 kilometres from the strategic town of Tawang in Arunachal Pradesh.

title: Electoral Roll Revision In Bengal, Tamil Nadu But Not Assam?. Election Commission Explains Why
content: Phase One of the nationwide rollout of voter roll revision -- an exercise being undertaken after 21 years -- includes two states where assembly elections are due next year. But there is a third which is not included.

title: Madhya Pradesh BJP Leader Allegedly Beats Farmer To Death, Drives Over Him

title: Thuingaleng Muivah‚Äôs homecoming: Where a Manipur village rekindles hope for Naga peace process
content: More than 60 years after he walked out to join the Naga movement that called for a separation from India in 1964, NSCN (I-M) general secretary Thuingaleng Muivah returned to Somdal, his birthplace in Manipur‚Äôs Ukhrul district for eight days. His homecoming rekindled hope for a settlement of the Naga peace process hanging fire for almost three decades and signalled a move for reconciliation in the ethnically volatile State

title: Stray dogs case: Supreme Court pulls up States, UTs over non-compliance with order, summons Chief Secretaries

content: In its 3 a.m. bulletin, the IMD said the storm is likely to continue to move west-northwestwards over southwest and westcentral Bay of Bengal during the next 12 hours and intensify into a Severe Cyclonic Storm by October 28

title: Cyclonic storm ‚ÄòMontha‚Äô: Guntur Commissioner orders removal of encroachments and strengthening of flood preparedness
content: In view of the heavy rains and strong winds forecast on account of impending  Montha cyclone, the Commissioner instructed officials to dismantle weak hoardings and temporary structures

content: Besides the widening and desilting of Adyar estuary, the CM instructed officials to undertake the widening and desilting works in Cooum, Muttukadu and Ennore estuaries

content: NC vice president and J&K Chief Minister Omar Abdullah said the NC had been betrayed by those people ‚Äúwho attended our meetings and ate with us‚Äù

content: While 19,220 hectares of land under MISTHI scheme has been taken up in Gujarat, only 10 hectares of mangrove plantation has been taken up in West Bengal which accounts for about 42% of mangrove cover in country

content: Mr. Jaishankar discussed the global and regional scenario with Singapore Counterpart Vivian Balakrishnan and deliberated on strengthening bilateral cooperation.¬†

content: Hitting out at the INDIA bloc, without taking names of the Opposition leaders, the CM said that before 2005 (when the RJD was in power), there was complete anarchy in the State

title: Tamil Nadu‚Äôs power demand remained flat in the first half of 2025-26
content: Its peak power demand has also been lower at¬†19,878 MW, when compared to the levels reached in the same period last year

title: Prashant Kishor‚Äôs home turf awaits verdict on Jan Suraaj promises
content: JSP leader Prashant Kishor last visited his ancestral village Konar in 2017, when his mother passed away; people here are hopeful that the leader can bring change if his candidates win the election

title: College in Vellore holds Endowment lecture
content: According to a press release, the lecture was organised in memory of Chandrabai Singhvi of the college.

title: 'Flying Chernobyl': Russia now has nuclear-powered missile; what is Burevestnik?
content: Russia successfully tested its nuclear-powered Burevestnik cruise missile, a weapon President Putin claims can "pierce any defence shield." The test, conducted alongside a nuclear drill, signals Moscow's defiance against Western pressure over Ukraine. Putin announced the country will now move towards deploying the "invincible" missile, which reportedly traveled 14,000 kilometers.

title: IND vs AUS: 'Stop!' India selectors given warning on Rohit and Virat selection
content: Former captain Krishnamachari Srikkanth urged the BCCI selectors to back Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli for the 2027 World Cup, emphasizing their fitness and recent performances. He advised clear communication, assuring the veterans of their importance and encouraging them to focus on staying fit to lead India to victory.

title: No SIR in Assam? Electoral rolls to be announced separately; EC explains why
content: The Election Commission will conduct a separate Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls in Assam due to unique legal provisions. Meanwhile, the second phase of SIR will cover 12 states and UTs, aiming to ensure accurate voter lists before upcoming polls.

title: TCS issues clarification: Don‚Äôt provide cybersecurity services to M&S
content: TCS has denied reports claiming Marks & Spencer terminated their contract following a ¬£300 million cyberattack. The IT firm stated the report contained factual inaccuracies and that it does not provide cybersecurity services to M&S. TCS clarified that their service desk contract with M&S concluded prior to the April 2025 cyber incident through a competitive RFP process.

title: Surya‚Äôs form a concern? Gambhir breaks silence: 'We‚Äôve made a decision'
content: Head coach Gautam Gambhir backs T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav despite recent batting dips, emphasizing an ultra-aggressive team philosophy where failures are accepted. Gambhir prioritizes a fearless brand of cricket over individual scores, highlighting Suryakumar's leadership and a dressing room culture built on trust and freedom from the fear of losing.

title: Whose gold is it? Wife‚Äôs Rs 1.65cr jewellery seized; husband moves ITAT & wins - explained
content: The Income Tax Appellate Tribunal ruled in favor of a taxpayer, stating that gold jewelry seized during a search could not be treated as unexplained investment in his hands. The Tribunal noted that the same assets were already declared and accepted in his wife's tax assessment, making a separate addition legally baseless.

title: Ex-Google exec to students: Remember, AI itself is going to be gone by...
content: Google's former AI team member Jad Tarifi advises students against pursuing lengthy AI doctoral programs, suggesting the field will evolve significantly by graduation. He recommends focusing on niche AI applications or prioritizing real-world experience and personal development, including emotional intelligence and empathy, for long-term success in the rapidly changing AI landscape.

title: UP's Mustafabad to be renamed? What CM Yogi said
content: In a move to honor cultural heritage, Uttar Pradesh's Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath declared the renaming of Mustafabad village in Lakhimpur Kheri to 'Kabirdham'. This decision seeks to revive the legacy of Sant Kabir, particularly underscoring the village's historical significance regardless of its current demographics. Adityanath's announcement aligns with other similar renaming efforts aimed at restoring the region's cultural roots.

title: Asia Cup handshake row: J&K CM bats for 'spirit of the game' - 'why not?'
content: Jammu and Kashmir CM Omar Abdullah expressed disappointment that the Indian cricket team did not shake hands with Pakistan's Salman Ali Agha's side during the Asia Cup. He emphasized playing in the spirit of the game and advocated for resuming bilateral cricket ties between the two nations.

title: Gainfully 'employed': Rajasthan Officer ‚Äòpays salaries‚Äô to wife for fake jobs
content: Jaipur's anti-corruption bureau has filed a case against a senior IT department officer, Pradhyuman Dixit, for allegedly orchestrating illegal salary payments to his wife, Poonam Dixit, through two private firms. Over Rs 30 lakh was deposited into her accounts between 2019 and 2020, despite her never working for the companies. Authorities suspect these payments were bribes for IT contract favors.

title: GM layoffs: Engineers fired on Microsoft Teams; Says it's business, not you
content: General Motors has let go of over 200 salaried employees, mainly CAD engineers, at its Michigan tech campus. This move, part of a restructuring to boost profits, follows strong third-quarter earnings and a raised financial outlook. GM stated the layoffs target execution roles to enhance core design capabilities. This comes as the automotive sector sees broader workforce reductions.

title: Shreyas Iyer still in ICU after dangerously low body vitals, internal bleeding
content: Indian cricketer Shreyas Iyer is currently in the ICU of a Sydney hospital following a serious fall during the third ODI against Australia. Reports indicate he experienced dangerously low body vitals post-incident and was immediately hospitalized in a critical, life-threatening condition. His recovery is ongoing.

title: Major update on Tom Aspinall following shocking eye poke spot at UFC 321
content: UFC 321's main event concluded controversially when Tom Aspinall was accidentally eye-poked by Ciryl Gane, rendering him unable to continue. Aspinall later shared an update, expressing significant concern about his eye injury, stating it's scarier than his previous knee injury. He has returned to England for further medical evaluation.

title: 'Attack' on CJI: Why SC refused to act against accused lawyer; will set up norms
content: The Supreme Court acknowledged shoe-hurling as contempt but declined action against the lawyer, citing potential glorification. The SCBA president criticized this, deeming it a joke on the institution. The apex court will instead issue guidelines on social media conduct and the glorification of such incidents.

title: iPhones boom, Trump sanctions impact: Electronics to become 2nd-most exported
content: India's electronics exports are surging, driven by booming iPhone production, and are projected to become the second-largest export category. This rise coincides with a potential decline in oil exports due to US sanctions on Russian crude, impacting refiners' purchases and eliminating price advantages.

title: Kolkata: Mob of 50 led by auto driver storms flat, assaults customs officer, wife
content: A customs inspector and his wife were brutally assaulted in their Kolkata home by a mob of 50, led by an auto driver, after a minor traffic altercation. Police, reportedly busy with Kali Puja immersions, arrived late, allowing most attackers to escape. Arrested individuals were quickly granted bail, sparking resident fears.

title: 'No one can compete with us': Tej Pratap says Mahua backing JJD; vows to work for Bihar
content: Janshakti Janata Dal (JJD) chief Tej Pratap Yadav expressed strong confidence ahead of the Bihar elections, asserting massive support in his Mahua constituency and claiming no one can compete with his party. He emphasized that voters will decide the next government and highlighted his party's agenda of development and public welfare.

title: Gold rate today below Rs 1.23 lakh per 10 grams. what‚Äôs the outlook?
content: Gold and silver prices saw a dip in early trading as investors booked profits after a recent rally and market fluctuations. Geopolitical tensions and upcoming US Fed policy meeting influenced traders to reduce positions at higher price points. Investors are now awaiting key US CPI data for further market direction.

title: UP highway horror: Sleeper bus gutted on Agra-Lucknow Expressway
content: A Delhi-Gonda sleeper bus caught fire early Sunday on the Agra-Lucknow Expressway. Driver Jagat Singh and aides Shyam Sundar and Manish swiftly evacuated all 39 passengers. Their quick thinking and brave actions prevented any loss of life. The bus was completely gutted before fire services arrived. Passengers praised the trio's courage.

title: 'Technical snag': Dubai-bound flight from Madurai diverted; no injuries reported
content: A Dubai-bound private jet from Madurai made an emergency landing in Chennai on Sunday due to a mid-air technical issue. The aircraft, carrying 160 passengers, landed safely without any reported injuries. This diversion follows a similar incident involving a SpiceJet flight returning to Delhi shortly after departure, also due to technical problems.

title: Bad air: Diwali AQI was near ‚Äòsevere‚Äô had data not gone missing
content: Diwali's vibrant celebrations took a somber turn as Delhi's air quality monitoring infrastructure faced an unprecedented breakdown on the festive night and the subsequent morning.

title: Molestation row: Wife of star Australia cricketer takes a jibe ‚Äî 'Police escort...'
content: Australian cricketer Ashleigh Gardner and her wife playfully highlighted India's security after an incident where two national players were allegedly molested in Indore.  Following the unsettling event, police provided an escort, prompting a humorous social media post.  Authorities swiftly apprehended the suspect in the earlier case.

title: How French police caught Louvre museum heist suspects
content: French authorities have arrested two suspects in connection with the Louvre's crown jewels heist. The arrests followed an analysis of forensic evidence, including DNA and fingerprints, and surveillance footage. One suspect was apprehended at the airport attempting to flee the country.

title: SC pulls up Delhi police on bail pleas of Umar Khalid, 3 others; next hearing on Friday
content: The Supreme Court on Monday adjourned the hearing on the bail pleas of activists Umar Khalid, Sharjeel Imam, and others in the Delhi riots UAPA case until October 31. The court granted time to the Delhi Police to file a reply after the Additional Solicitor General sought a two-week extension.

title: Watch: Desi mom hires band to wake up her kids; video wins internet
content: A creative Indian mother's attempt to wake her children with a dhol band went viral, showcasing a unique parenting tactic. Despite the loud music, the kids remained unfazed, pulling blankets over their heads.  Internet was quick to react to the heartwarming video that sparked amusement and debate online, highlighting a playful approach to morning routines.

title: Emiru-Mizkif controversy: How Twitch star‚Äôs breakup led to assault claims
content: Twitch streamer Emiru publicly accused ex-boyfriend Mizkif of sexual assault, emotional abuse, stalking, and blackmail threats. She detailed disturbing past threats and a new warning sign at TwitchCon 2025, prompting her to speak out for her safety. Mizkif admitted to toxic fights but denied assault, while Emiru is pursuing restraining orders.

title: Blink and it's gone: China unveils world's fastest train
content: China's new CR450 bullet train has set a world speed record, reaching 453 km/h during testing. This innovative train, capable of accelerating to 350 km/h in under five minutes, is set to enter commercial service by 2026. The advanced design, featuring a streamlined nose cone, solidifies China's leadership in high-speed rail.

title: BJP MLA Ravi Negi falls into Yamuna during reel shoot on cleanup drive
content: BJP MLA Ravi Negi's reel shoot in Yamuna turned dramatic as he fell in, thankfully unhurt. Meanwhile, AAP accused BJP of creating a "fake" Yamuna ghat with filtered water for PM Modi, while devotees face pollution. BJP countered, calling AAP's claims "political frustration" and highlighting their efforts to clean ghats.

title: Janhvi Kapoor stuns in a 20-yr-old vintage dress priced at staggering Rs 5 lakh - pics
content: Janhvi Kapoor flaunted a vibrant, archival yellow printed mini dress that was not only a lesson vintage glamour but also came with an equally staggering price tag. Read on to learn more about Janhvi Kapoor's timeless yet luxe fashion moment right here.

title: SA name 15-man squad for India Tests; Bavuma to captain
content: South Africa has unveiled its 15-member squad for the upcoming Test series in India, with captain Temba Bavuma returning after injury.  The Proteas have made minimal changes, banking on a blend of seasoned players and emerging talent to tackle the challenging subcontinental conditions.  This series presents a significant opportunity for South Africa to break their winless streak on Indian soil.

title: Delhi weather: Sunny skies, no rain; AQI remains very poor
content: New Delhi enjoys a sunny and pleasant Monday with temperatures reaching 31.7¬∞C, ideal for outdoor plans. However, air quality remains a concern, with yesterday's AQI at 281 (Very Poor) due to high pollutants. While today's weather might slightly disperse pollutants, masks are advised for traffic-heavy areas. The week ahead promises mostly clear skies, except for Tuesday's potential rain.

title: I-T withheld Rs 1.5 cr refund citing TDS mismatch - how taxpayer approached HC & won
content: Taxpayers facing refund delays due to TDS mismatches in Form 26AS have a reason to cheer. A recent Allahabad High Court ruling mandates tax authorities to accept taxpayer-provided TDS documentation, like Form 16A, for verification. This decision prevents Assessing Officers from arbitrarily withholding legitimate refunds, shifting the verification burden to them.

title: Delhi horror: MBBS student invited to 'hotel party', drugged, raped and filmed: accused flees
content: An 18-year-old MBBS student was allegedly raped and blackmailed by a 20-year-old man at a Delhi hotel. The accused reportedly drugged and sexually assaulted her, with associates helping to take compromising photos and videos for coercion. A case has been registered under the Bharatiya Nyay Samhita.

title: Iyer in ICU: Family could fly to Sydney soon, BCCI making arrangements
content: Indian cricketer Shreyas Iyer is hospitalized in Sydney following a fall during an ODI against Australia. He is in the ICU due to internal bleeding from a spleen laceration and is being closely monitored. The BCCI is arranging for his family to join him as he recovers, with his condition stable but requiring continued observation.

title: 3I/ ATLAS could uncover the universe‚Äôs greatest mystery by October 30
content: Renowned physicist Michio Kaku predicts astronomers may soon determine if interstellar object 3I/ATLAS is natural or artificial. By late October 2025, its solar encounter could reveal unusual energy gains, hinting at intelligent guidance. This potential discovery, reminiscent of 'Oumuamua, could be the first tangible sign of extraterrestrial technology, redefining humanity's cosmic place.

title: Jharkhand blood bank blunder: HIV-positive blood given to 5 kids
content: Two officials are suspended following an incident where five children received HIV-positive blood. The Jharkhand Chief Minister announced financial aid and free treatment for the affected children. A probe panel will investigate the matter and suggest reforms. The High Court has also ordered an investigation into the serious lapse at Chaibasa Sadar Hospital.

title: Tragic! Indian Jujitsu player found dead; family alleges workplace harassment
content: International Jujitsu player Rohini Kalam, 35, was found dead at her Dewas residence, with preliminary findings suggesting suicide. Her sister reported work-related stress and alleged harassment from her school principal. Rohini, who had aspirations of becoming an IPS officer and had recently undergone surgery, was a decorated athlete with multiple international accolades.

title: Delhi: Man strangles wife to death while daughter slept in same room
content: A 45-year-old priest was arrested in Delhi for allegedly strangling his wife and attempting to stage it as a suicide. He called the police claiming his wife had hanged herself, but inconsistencies in his statement led to his confession during interrogation. The couple had reportedly argued before the incident.

title: Sold land, crossed jungles: Over 50 Indians handcuffed, deported from US; agent vanishes with crores
content: Recently, more than 50 individuals, most between the ages of 25 and 30, found themselves back in Haryana after being deported from the US while trying to enter through the 'dunki' route. One deportee expressed frustration over losing Rs 57 lakh to a deceitful agent, facing intimidation and possible jail sentences as a result.

title: Shreyas Iyer in ICU: How the nasty fall turned into an emergency in Sydney
content: Team India's Shreyas Iyer is in Sydney's ICU after a severe fall during an ODI against Australia. He sustained a left rib cage injury while taking a catch, leading to alarming vital drops and internal bleeding, possibly a splenic rupture. Iyer's condition is now stable but under close medical watch.

title: JNU Polls 2025-26: Candidates file nominations today; when will the final list release?
content: Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) has entered the key phase of its 2025-26 student union elections, with candidates filing nominations on October 27. The final list of contestants will be released on October 28, followed by campaigning, debates, and polling on November 4. Results are expected on November 6, reflecting the campus‚Äôs dynamic political landscape.

title: Wetzel: As bad as this is, the next betting scandal is coming
content: almost every sports league, team and operation wants in on sports wagering revenue . sponsorships, partnerships. advertising. maybe it's direct payments . sports is awash in gambling cash . more than 30 people were arrested, including big shots .

title: VAR review: Was Sunderland's goal offside? Did Gakpo deserve a penalty?
content: Janusz Michallik reacts to sunderland's 2-1 defeat in the premier league . the video assistant referee causes controversy every week in the Premier league, but how are decisions made and are they correct? we take a look at the major incidents to examine and explain the process in terms of VAR protocol and the Laws of the Game .

title: üöò Eagles' revenge on Giants leads NFL trolls
content: the Philadelphia Eagles defeated the New York Giants 38-20 at home . the Eagles signal-caller had 179 passing yards and four touchdowns . trolls poke fun at the "Fly Eagles Fly" chant .

title: Aussies beat U.S., win LPGA International Crown
content: minjee Lee and Hannah Green take both of their singles matches to win the LPGA's international crown . the foursomes match between Australians Stephanie Kyriacou and Grace Kim finished in a tie . it's the first win for australia at the match-play tournament, which eluded them in 2023 .

title: Week 9 Power Rankings: Top 5 stays consistent; Houston and Utah join the list
content: Ole Miss' road win against Oklahoma makes the Rebels a virtual lock for the playoff . deion Sanders summed it up after watching his team give up 587 yards of offense in a 53-7 loss to Utah . "this is probably the worst beating I've ever had except when my momma whooped me as a kid," Sanders said .

title: Rink report: The most intriguing Frozen Frenzy matchups to watch
content: all 32 teams are in action on the "Hockey Christmas" day . the night includes a tripleheader on ESPN . a red zone-style whip-around show hosted by John Buccigross and Kevin Weekes .

title: Projecting the CFP top 12 after Week 9: Vandy's in the field!
content: Vanderbilt Commodores is on the brink of making its first appearance in any CFP ranking during the playoff era . if the playoff were today, they would already be in the top 12 when the first ranking is released Nov. 4 . there's a chance to make their debut in the coveted top 12 .

title: Where LSU ranks among the open Power 4 jobs
content: all four power conferences have had a firing in the first half of the season . the u.s. has a combined record of 298-150 in the FBS . there are eight power 4 schools looking for head coaches .

title: How the matchups line up for all 46 postseason games
content: all four of those teams are in the mix for the college football Playoff . the five highest-ranked conference champions, plus the next seven highest-rated teams, will make the field . last season's inaugural 12-team CFP, the five most-ranked conferences champions will be awarded first-round byes .
